description.narrative: Torture has always been an interrogation tool in the mentality of police officers and this concept is widespread among government officials in general as it is believed to drag admissions out of suspects without a real interest for their validity. Even in the public opinion it is accepted that suspects get tortured as it would be the only way to deal with criminals and drug addicts.Consequently the legal + social situation in Egypt seriously needs a strategic plan to integrate human rights principles and un derstanding into the legal + social context. The FREE project aims at constructing a common perception towards civil rights as a corresponding notion to human dignity and freedom so as to end human rights violations and promote the rule of law. The project activities will be divided into three main components:- Establishing four legal aid centers and training lawyers to provide legal support to victims of torture and facilitate their access to legal + media resources.- Working with NGOs + the civil society to raise social awareness on torture as a crime and promoting the right to physical integrity. - Implementing strategies to improve the skills of judges + prosecutors and expand their ability in handling relevant legal cases fairly + efficiently.
